abstract.p: Irish Department of Finance reports budget surplus of 2.9 billion Irish pounds ($3.5 billion) for first six months of year, increase of 44 percent over year-earlier period; Government says revenues from income tax increased 15 percent, despite introduction of significant tax cuts in January; Exchequer now anticipates year-end surplus of 1.8 billion Irish pounds ($2.2 billion) (S)

block.p: The Irish Department of Finance reported a budget surplus of 2.9 billion Irish pounds ($3.5 billion) for the first six months of the year, an increase of 44 percent over the comparable period in 1999. Government revenues from income tax increased 15 percent, despite the introduction of significant tax cuts in January. With increased spending the rest of the year, the Exchequer now anticipates a year-end surplus of 1.8 billion Irish pounds ($2.2 billion).

With increased spending the rest of the year, the Exchequer now anticipates a year-end surplus of 1.8 billion Irish pounds ($2.2 billion).
